intro: Siphocampylus reflexus, commonly known as the bentleaf cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant has alternate, pinnately divided leaves that are often curled or reflexed, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Siphocampylus reflexus is a short-lived perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
